comments.body: I'm taking a look at https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/3512 which pinned `h2o` to figure out why we needed to pin `h2o`.
If we do not specify the h2o version, can we ensure h2o py and R are the same version ?
e.g. h2o release a new R-package, but conda side haven't update to the latest version.

> h2o release a new R-package, but conda side haven't update to the latest version.

Yeah, this might happen.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@reticulate::conda_install(Sys.getenv("MLFLOW_HOME", "../../../../."), envname = mlflow:::mlflow_conda_env_name(), pip = TRUE)
reticulate::conda_install("xgboost", envname = mlflow:::mlflow_conda_env_name())
reticulate::conda_install("h2o", envname = mlflow:::mlflow_conda_env_name(), pip = TRUE)

# The default timeout value (60 seconds) can be insufficient for `spark_install` to complete

comments.body: This doesn't mean `spark_install` takes 1 hour. It usually completes within a minute but can be very slow and take > 30 miniutes sometimes.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +17,21 @@
# The default timeout value (60 seconds) can be insufficient for `spark_install` to complete
options(timeout=60 * 60)

spark_version_file <- "../.spark-version"
